title: Standard Form
text: If there is a constant coefficient in the numerator, we shift the multiplier to the denominator by multiplying by the reciprocal of the constant. For e.g., a(x-h)**/b will be divided by $$\frac{\frac{1}{a}}{\frac{1}{a}}$$ so that it becomes $$\frac{{\left(x-h\right)}^2}{\frac{b}{a}}$$. This will allow us to obtain the standard form.
